message: I go back inside and shut the door to the balcony behind me. After I set Ren on the bed, I lie down next to him.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Rhyme..."
Was I really ganked?
When we were on the Rhyme field, Ren appeared in Online Mode and responded to my commands.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Set... something. What was it?"
When it happened, my mouth just started moving on its own, almost like I was possessed. What the hell was that?
And why did it feel... familiar?
It felt kind of like it does when I'm turning on the charm with customers on the phone. Like when I know just the right words to say to win someone over.
Anyway, I wonder how often gankings happen. Maybe I should look into that.
Not that I really want to dig too deep...
...A message.

name: 蒼葉
message: "The latest Allmate models, huh?"
Spam. New models are coming out all the time.
I skim the message, then close my Coil.
I've always been the type to develop sentimental attachments to things I use, but I guess most people in the world aren't like that.

Whatever. Ren's all I need.
...That's right. I need to give Ren a checkup.
I sit up in bed and tap the furry blue lump in my lap.

name: 蓮
message: "Aoba."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Good morning."

name: 蓮
message: "Good morning."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'm gonna take a look at you now."
Ren is an older model, so fixing any serious malfunctions would be a real pain in the ass.
I have to make sure I keep a close eye on him and perform regular maintenance.
I pick up a long cable connected to my desktop PC and plug it into the port beneath the fur on Ren's neck.
I open my Coil and run a system diagnostic.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hmm... Looks like your reaction speed might be a little slow."
I pick up the toolbox sitting on the floor. Parting Ren's fur again, I use a screwdriver to open a small square hatch on the back of his neck.
With most Allmates, you can do all the maintenance you'd need to from your Coil, but Ren is such an old model that I have to fiddle with his insides directly.
Using tweezers, I pull some new chips from the toolbox and swap them out with the ones in Ren's neck.

name: 蒼葉
message: "That should do it."
I shut the maintenance hatch, close the control panel, and unplug the cable, then pick Ren up.

name: 蒼葉
message: "How's that? Anything feel weird?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hm?"

name: 蓮
message: "Something does feel a little strange. However, it is within acceptable parameters."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Okay, well, I did just change some chips. Let me know right away if anything goes wrong."

name: 蓮
message: "Understood."
I stroke Ren's back and nuzzle my forehead against his.
I always do this after performing maintenance on Ren. I don't remember when I started, but it's become a kind of ritual, like knocking on wood.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Thanks for everything."

name: 蓮
message: "It's my pleasure, Aoba."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'm counting on you, buddy."

name: 蓮
message: "It's my pleasure, Aoba."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...You always say that."

name: 蓮
message: "Is that strange?"
